Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.


Director..........:  Oliver Hirschbiegel

Writers...........:  Joachim Fest (Book), Bernd Eichinger (Screenplay)

Starring..........:  Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Ulrich Matthes

NOTE:  The other Grym release of 'Der Untergang' was from an Portuguese/Brazilian
       edition. I used that edition because it had DTS-HD Master audio and higher
       video bitrate. 

       Later on I was made aware that there where an error in the encoding. I also
       found out that this particular edition of 'Der Untergang' is approx. 3 min
       shorter than for example the US editions (both @ 23.976 fps) and I tried
       making search on the net to find out the differences between the editions. 
       But no luck.

       So the RERIP is from the US release of 'Der Untergang' with "only" DD-5.1
       audio, lower bitrate and hardcoded english subs. But don't let that   
       discourage you - the film still sounds and looks beautiful. :)

       Enjoy this excellent flick!

2) How can I watch your so-called non cropped rip in your so-called 2.35:1
   Anamorphic Widescreen image, mate?

   You can watch the movie in original 2.35:1 Anamorphic Widescreen
   (Anamorphic Lens), like you do in the theater, by setting the aspect ratio in 
   your software player to 2.35:1. 

   Turn off any automatic or manual 16:9 cropping on your TV - if any and if used.

   If set correct then the image on your 16:9 flat screen should look something
   like the screen croppings in this link:

  <a href=" http://someimage.com/Q2le" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://someimage.com/Q2le</a> 

   You got image like in the link? 
   Now please search 'Anamorphic Widescreen' in Youtube for more reference.
    
   Ok, now do same playback procedure with a so called "2.35:1" 1920x800 rip.
